intro: Rhodalsine geniculata var. communis, commonly known as the common rhodalsine, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
